channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Haunted by hopelessness: 12 Zambians share their stories as HIV drugs run out
item.description: Mothers and children, husbands and wives, doctors, truck drivers and religious leaders are all grappling with the fallout from the sudden U.S. cuts in aid.
item.content:encoded: Mothers and children, husbands and wives, doctors, truck drivers and religious leaders are all grappling with the fallout from the sudden U.S. cuts in aid.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: How cutting Medicaid would affect long-term care and family caregivers
item.description: The federal program is the biggest source of money for long-term care for the elderly and disabled. Republican proposals to cut its budget could jeopardize supports family and caregivers rely on.
item.content:encoded:
The federal program is the biggest source of money for long-term care for the elderly and disabled. Republican proposals to cut its budget could jeopardize supports family and caregivers rely on.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Kat McGowan

item.title: In Sudan, hundreds killed in attacks on famine-hit displacement camps
item.description: Sudanese paramilitary group the Rapid Support Forces has claimed it has taken control of famine-hit Zamzam camp, after days of deadly fighting in the Darfur region.
item.content:encoded:
Sudanese paramilitary group the Rapid Support Forces has claimed it has taken control of famine-hit Zamzam camp, after days of deadly fighting in the Darfur region.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Why Trump exempted electronics from tariffs. And, Meta's biggest trial begins today
item.description: Trump spared electronics from his sweeping tariffs. Here's why he wants to levy semiconductors next. And, the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust case against Meta begins today.
item.content:encoded:
Trump spared electronics from his sweeping tariffs. Here's why he wants to levy semiconductors next. And, the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust case against Meta  begins today.

(Image credit: Ng Han Guan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Ukrainians in the U.S. use connections and their art to support the war effort
item.description: Amid concerns over Trump's foreign policy and Russian influence, Ukrainians look for new ways to raise awareness.
item.content:encoded:
Amid concerns over Trump's foreign policy and Russian influence, Ukrainians look for new ways to raise awareness.

(Image credit: Patrick Davis)
item.dc:creator: Patrick Davis

item.title: Anxiety drugs found in rivers make salmon take more risks
item.description: New research suggests that pharmaceutical pollution can change the behavior of salmon in the wild.
item.content:encoded:
New research suggests that pharmaceutical pollution can change the behavior of salmon in the wild.

(Image credit: slowmotiongli/Getty Images/)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Troops arrive at the border to help with enforcement despite fewer migrant crossings
item.description: According to the U.S. Army, soldiers won't be arresting people suspected of being in the country illegally, and instead will offer "logistical support" to Border Patrol agents.
item.content:encoded:
According to the U.S. Army, soldiers won't be arresting people suspected of being in the country illegally, and instead will offer "logistical support" to Border Patrol agents.

(Image credit: Carlos Morales)
item.dc:creator: Carlos Morales

item.title: Move over Paleo diet, it's Dinosaur Time, a TikTok trend all about devouring veggies
item.description: On social media, people are gobbling up greens like they are giant primeval beasts. Nutritionists say it's not a bad way to get more fiber and micronutrients in.
item.content:encoded: On social media, people are gobbling up greens like they are giant primeval beasts. Nutritionists say it's not a bad way to get more fiber and micronutrients in.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: DOGE abruptly cut a program for teens with disabilities. This student is 'devastated'
item.description: The program, Charting My Path for Future Success, aimed to help teens with disabilities transition from high school to the real world. It abruptly ended when DOGE terminated its federal contract.
item.content:encoded:
The program, Charting My Path for Future Success, aimed to help teens with disabilities transition from high school to the real world. It abruptly ended when DOGE terminated its federal contract.

(Image credit: Cassandra Klos for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Is it 'Made in USA'? The answer can be complicated
item.description: In a global economy, something called "substantial transformation" comes into play when the U.S. determines where a product is made.
item.content:encoded:
In a global economy, something called "substantial transformation" comes into play when the U.S. determines where a product is made.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
